newsitem.title: USA: Michigan jobless rate falls to 4.5 pct in Feb..
newsitem.headline: Michigan jobless rate falls to 4.5 pct in Feb..

text.p: Michigan's seasonally adjusted unemployment rate fell in February to 4.5 percent, the lowest level since at least 1970, the state's employment security agency reported Wednesday.

The number of jobless workers declined last month by 21,000 to 219,000. In January, Michigan's jobless rate stood at 4.9 percent with 240,000 jobless workers. In February 1996, the state's unemployment rate was five percent.
The state agency also reported the number of workers with jobs climbed by 22,000 in February to a record 4.67 million.
